description.narrative: Strengthened health sector response in HIV prevention, treatment, and care and support services to women, adolescents and children,which contributes to Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Hiv Prevention, Hiv â€“ General, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Increased national and sub-national equitable coverage of quality reproductive, maternal, newborn, child health, HIV/AIDS and nutrition services

sector.narrative: HIV and AIDS monitoring and bottleneck analysis

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened health sector response in HIV prevention, treatment, and care and support services to women, adolescents and children
% children receiving ART in comparison to children receiving pre-ART care who are lost to follow-up

actual.value: 2015:- Lost in Pre-ART children in 2015 is 59 cases. It is less than 2014, 71 cases. However, it increased among ART children, in 2014, 58 cases, increased to 89 cases in 2015.

title.narrative: % pregnant women attending ANC or delivery, % male partners of HIV+PW, % severely malnourished children admitted for treatment who are tested for HIV and received their results.

actual.value:
2015:Nationally, pregnant women who received HIV testing during ANC and delivery and returned for the result is estimated at 80% (230,048 tested cases)
Percentage of pregnant women' partners who received HIV testing reached 18%. HIV testing data among SAM children is not available yet.

title.narrative: % children < 15 yrs with advanced HIV infection receiving ART

actual.value: 2015:As of September 2015, the percentage of HIV infected children who receive ART is 3841 (80.50%). In this reporting period, 67 children who are more than 14 years old were transferred out to adults ART service.

title.narrative: % HIV-exposed infants received an HIV DNA PCR test before the age of two months

actual.value: 2015:No update, new data will be available in December 2015.
